articles.title: Ireland halts use of AstraZeneca vaccine following blood clot reports in Norway
articles.description: Ireland temporarily suspended the use of the AstraZeneca Covid-19 vaccine on Sunday following a report from Norway of patients developing blood clots post inoculation.

articles.title: Jerome Powell can't take his eyes off the job market
articles.description: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell has made it very clear that unlike some investors, he's not stressed out about a potential rise in inflation later this year. And there's good reason for that: he's busy worrying about jobs.

articles.title: Powerful storm system brings with it blizzard conditions, more snow, rain and flood concerns
articles.description: More than seven million Americans are under winter weather alerts and about 300,000 under blizzard warnings Sunday morning amidst a powerful storm system that blanketed parts of the western Plains with snow and unleashed violent tornadoes in Texas.

articles.title: Crews were dredging the river. Instead of muck, they pulled up three cannons and a mystery
articles.description: Dredging the Savannah River is like a box of chocolates, say those who head up the task. You never know what you're gonna find. How about three cannons that may date to the American Revolution, an anchor and a likely piece of ship's timber?

articles.title: America is obsessed with the Royals. So we make our own
articles.description: We elevate our closest options -- politicians, presidents and famous families --  to imaginary thrones. This is a type of parasocial relationship: We care about these people, even if we don't actually know them at all.
